{{also|heissen|héissen}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|de|heissen||Switzerland|Liechtenstein}} * {{alter|de|heyßen||obsolete}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈhaɪ̯sn̩/|/ˈhaɪ̯sən/}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-heißen.ogg}} * {{audio|de|De-heißen.ogg}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|gmh|heizen}}, from {{inh|de|goh|heizzan}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*haitaną}}. Cognate with {{cog|nds-de|[[heiten]] {{q|Paderbornisch}}}}, {{cog|nl|heten}} and archaic {{cog|en|hight|t=to name; to be named}}. Compare also with {{cog|en|hest}}, {{m|en|behest}}. Compare also {{cog|yi|הייסן}}. ====Verb==== {{de-verb-strong|class=7|heißt|hieß|geheißen|past subjunctive=hieße}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to have a [[name]]; to be [[named]]; to [[be called]]; {{non-gloss definition|but implying that one “owns” this name, not necessarily that one goes by it}} #: {{ux|de|Wie '''heißt''' du?|What is your name?}} #: {{ux|de|Ich '''heiße''' ...|I'''’m called''' ...|inline=1}} #: {{ux|de|Ich werde Lutz genannt, aber ich '''heiße''' Ludger.|They call me Lutz, but my name is Ludger.}} # {{lb|de|intransitive|or|transitive}} to [[mean]]; to have a meaning #: {{ux|de|Das '''heißt''', dass wir nur noch wenig Zeit haben.|This '''means''' that we have but little time left.}} #: {{ux|de|Was [or: Wie] '''heißt''' „Auto“ auf Englisch?|What '''is''' ‘Auto’ in English?}} # {{lb|de|impersonal}} to [[say]], to be said; to [[go]], [[run]] (like) #: {{ux|de|Es '''heißt''', dass ...|It '''is said''' that ...; They say that ...|inline=1}} # {{lb|de|transitive|archaic|_|except in fixed expressions}} to [[call]] (someone something) #: {{ux|de|Er hat mich einen Idioten '''geheißen'''.|He '''called''' me an idiot.}} #: {{ux|de|Ich '''heiße''' Sie herzlich willkommen!|I welcome you cordially!|lit=I '''call''' you cordially welcome!}} # {{lb|de|transitive|archaic}} to [[order]], to [[direct]], to [[call]] to do something #: {{ux|de|Sie '''hieß''' ihn, nach der Schule anzurufen.|She '''told''' him to call after school}} =====Usage notes===== * Colloquially, the past participle {{m|de|gehießen}} is sometimes heard (by analogy with verbs such as {{m|de|meiden}}, {{m|de|scheinen}}, {{m|de|treiben}}). =====Conjugation===== {{de-conj-strong|heiß|hieß|geheißen|h||||a||||a}} =====Synonyms===== * {{sense|mean}} {{l|de|bedeuten}} * {{sense|call}} {{l|de|nennen}} * {{sense|order}} {{l|de|anweisen}};
